VLIB_gradientV5x5PyramidKernel_8

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_gradientV5x5PyramidKernel_8 (const uint8_t *restrict pIn, int16_t *restrict pB, uint16_t width, uint16_t pitch, uint16_t height, uint8_t *restrict pOut)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_gradientV5x5PyramidKernel_8 ( const uint8_t *restrict  pIn,
int16_t *restrict  pB,
uint16_t  width,
uint16_t  pitch,
uint16_t  height,
uint8_t *restrict  pOut 
)

Description
This function can be used to calculate the horizontal portion of the next level of a pyramid. Given a pointer to a rectangular region of interest described by W (input data width), P (input data pitch), and H (input data height), this kernel returns (W-4)/2 x (H-3)/2 values. For example, if H=5, it will calculate a single row of results. The filter used is: 

            -1  -4  -6  -4  -1
            -2  -8  -12 -8  -2
    V5  =    0   0   0   0   0
             2   8   12  8   2
             1   4   6   4   1
After the filtering step, the intermediate results are rounded and scaled to values 0-255 (the output value of 128 indicates no gradient) as shown in the following equation: 

        Gv = ((conv2(A,V5) + 64) >> 7) + 128;
Parameters:
[in] *pIn Input image (UQ8.0)
[in] *pB 5 x (width-4) temporary array (UQ16.0)
[in] width Input width (UQ16.0)
[in] pitch Pitch of the input data (UQ16.0)
[in] height Input height (UQ16.0)
[out] *pOut Output image (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • (width-4) must be a multiple of 8
  • pitch should be greater than or equal to width
  • height must be greater than 4
  • pIn is a pointer to an (pitch x height) array of unsigned 8 bit data
  • pOut is a pointer to an (width-4)/2 x (height-3)/2 array of unsigned 8 bit data
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
